Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Preoperative and Postoperative Imatinib in Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor (GIST) Patients

Participants.evidence: Eligible patients had histologically confirmed kit-expressing GIST ≥ 1 cm, untreated with chemotherapy.

Intervention.evidence: Nineteen patients were randomised to receive 3, 5, or 7 days of preoperative imatinib (300 mg twice daily) and 2 years of postoperative imatinib (600 mg daily).

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the safety and efficacy of preoperative and postoperative imatinib in GIST patients undergoing surgical resection.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was tumor cell apoptosis, measured postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed by the institutional department of biostatistics, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Nineteen patients were randomised, and 17 were analysed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Tumor cell apoptosis increased by an average of 12% (p = 0.04).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar to an imatinib-naïve cohort (p ≥ 0.1).

Funding.evidence: Funding: No funding source influenced the study.
